/v4.8.3/contracts/utils/structs/EnumerableSet.sol":{"keccak256":"0x9ec0d82ee53d4137be44f1f38f9a82d0d3a2027b3b8b226a5a90e4ee76e926d6","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://f783b453420dee16bb4f0839e3d2485d753d2dcd317adbeecb7e510c39563f57","dweb:/ipfs/QmUd4BeCaw6ZujaYvvMrCn2BNqmiP4bt4eA9rxiXY5od5E"]}},"version":1}

params.chains: A list of chains and their new permission status & rate limits. Rate limits are only used when the chain is being added through `allowed` being true.

returns._0: true is enabled, false if not.

getRemotePool(uint64).details: To support non-evm chains, this value is encoded into bytes

getRemoteToken(uint64).details: To support non-evm chains, this value is encoded into bytes

params.remoteChainSelector: The selector of the remote chain.

returns._0: true if the given chain is a permissioned remote chain.
true if the token is supported by the pool.

params.lockOrBurnIn: Encoded data fields for the processing of tokens on the source chain.

returns.lockOrBurnOut: Encoded data fields for the processing of tokens on the destination chain.

params.releaseOrMintIn: All data required to release or mint tokens.

returns._0: releaseOrMintOut The amount of tokens released or minted on the local chain, denominated in the local token's decimals.

params.inboundConfig: The new inbound rate limiter config, meaning the offRamp rate limits for the given chain.
params.outboundConfig: The new outbound rate limiter config, meaning the onRamp rate limits for the given chain.
params.remoteChainSelector: The remote chain selector for which the rate limits apply.
The remote chain selector for which the remote pool address is being set.
params.remotePoolAddress: The address of the remote pool.

acceptOwnership().notice: Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient.

applyAllowListUpdates(address[],address[.notice: Apply updates to the allow list.

applyChainUpdates((uint64,bool,bytes,byt.notice: Sets the permissions for a list of chains selectors. Actual senders for these chains need to be allowed on the Router to interact with this pool.

getAllowListEnabled().notice: Gets whether the allowList functionality is enabled.

getCurrentInboundRateLimiterState(uint64.notice: Gets the token bucket with its values for the block it was requested at.

getCurrentOutboundRateLimiterState(uint6.notice: Gets the token bucket with its values for the block it was requested at.

getRemotePool(uint64).notice: Gets the pool address on the remote chain.

getRemoteToken(uint64).notice: Gets the token address on the remote chain.

getToken().notice: Gets the IERC20 token that this pool can lock or burn.

isSupportedChain(uint64).notice: Checks whether a remote chain is supported in the token pool.

isSupportedToken(address).notice: Returns if the token pool supports the given token.

lockOrBurn((bytes,uint64,address,uint256.notice: Lock tokens into the pool or burn the tokens.

releaseOrMint((bytes,uint64,address,uint.notice: Releases or mints tokens to the receiver address.

setChainRateLimiterConfig(uint64,(bool,u.notice: Sets the chain rate limiter config.

setRemotePool(uint64,bytes).notice: Sets the remote pool address for a given chain selector.

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: Signals which version of the pool interface is supported

transferOwnership(address).notice: Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address.

@notice Base abstract class with common functions for all token pools. A token pool serves as isolated place for
 holding tokens and token specific logic that may execute as tokens move across the bridge.
